title: Connect an External Speaker to Your Echo, Echo Dot, or Other Alexa Device

steps.title: Activate pairing mode on your Bluetooth speaker.
steps.content: Activate pairing mode on your Bluetooth speaker. Most Bluetooth speakers have a pairing button that you will have to hold down. If you are uncertain, review your Bluetooth speaker's user guide for more information. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Select your Echo from the Devices tab in the Alexa app.
steps.content: Select your Echo from the Devices tab in the Alexa app. The Devices tab is at the bottom center of the app screen. From there, you will see a list of your connected Amazon devices. Tap on the Echo device to which you’ll be adding a speaker.

steps.title: Tap the Device Settings icon.
steps.content: Tap the Device Settings icon. It looks like a gear at the top right corner of the device menu.

steps.title: Tap Bluetooth Devices.
steps.content: Tap Bluetooth Devices . It’s near the top of the menu, under the Wireless header.

steps.title: Select Pair A New Device.
steps.content: Select Pair A New Device . You’ll see this blue button at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Tap your speaker in the list of available devices.
steps.content: Tap your speaker in the list of available devices. If you successfully put your speaker in pairing mode, you should see it in the list that appears on the next screen. Tap on it to select it. After a moment, the speaker should connect to your Echo.

steps.title: Use voice commands to connect or disconnect your speaker.
steps.content: Use voice commands to connect or disconnect your speaker. Once you’ve made the initial pairing, you can ask your Echo device to connect to your Bluetooth speaker at any time. Use a command like “Alexa, connect to [your speaker’s name]” or “Alexa, pair Bluetooth” to connect. You can disconnect this way, too. For example, say “Alexa, disconnect from [your speaker’s name].” You can also connect or disconnect your speaker in the Alexa app. Go to Devices > [your Echo device] and tap on your speaker to connect or disconnect. If you’re unable to connect, make sure your speaker is charged, in pairing mode, and close to your Echo. You might also need to check if the speaker is currently connected to a different device.

steps.title: Connect from the on-screen settings on an Echo Show or Echo Spot.
steps.content: Connect from the on-screen settings on an Echo Show or Echo Spot. If your Echo device has a screen, you don’t have to use the Alexa app. To connect: [2] X Research source Make sure your Bluetooth speaker is in pairing mode. Say, “Echo, go to settings,” or swipe down from the top of the screen and select Settings . Select Bluetooth , then find your device in the list and tap it to connect.

steps.title: Find or purchase a 3.5mm audio cable.
steps.content: Find or purchase a 3.5mm audio cable. If you do not already have one, purchase a 3.5mm audio cable – also known as an aux cord – that has male connections on each end. Many speakers already come with one of these cables. Before you buy a new one, check to see if one is included with your speaker.

steps.title: Plug one end of the audio cable into your Alexa device.
steps.content: Plug one end of the audio cable into your Alexa device. On the back of your Alexa device, you should see two inputs: one for the power source and a round one for an audio cable. Plug the audio cable into the circular port.

steps.title: Plug the other end of the audio cable into your external speaker.
steps.content: Plug the other end of the audio cable into your external speaker. Take the other end of the audio cable and plug it into the external speaker you wish to use. The location of the “Aux In” connection differs from speaker to speaker, so consult the speaker manual if you cannot locate it.

steps.title: Make sure both devices are turned on.
steps.content: Make sure both devices are turned on. Once the audio cord is connected to both devices, make sure they are both powered on and you will be all set. The next time you ask Alexa something or play music on the Echo, the sound will come out of the external speaker.
